   20: 
   21: -module(otp_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   24:          init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1]).
   25: -export([undefined_functions/1,deprecated_not_in_obsolete/1,
   26:          obsolete_but_not_deprecated/1,call_to_deprecated/1,
   27:          call_to_size_1/1,call_to_now_0/1,strong_components/1,
   28:          erl_file_encoding/1,xml_file_encoding/1,
   29:          runtime_dependencies_functions/1,
   30:          runtime_dependencies_modules/1,
   31:          test_runtime_dependencies_versions/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: -import(lists, [filter/2,foldl/3,foreach/2]).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   39:      {timetrap, {minutes, 30}}].
   40: 
   41: all() ->
   42:     [undefined_functions, deprecated_not_in_obsolete,
   43:      obsolete_but_not_deprecated, call_to_deprecated,
   44:      call_to_size_1, call_to_now_0, strong_components,
   45:      erl_file_encoding, xml_file_encoding,
   46:      runtime_dependencies_functions,
   47:      runtime_dependencies_modules,
   48:      test_runtime_dependencies_versions
   49: ].
   50: 
   51: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     Server = start_xref_server(daily_xref, functions),
   53:     [{xref_server,Server}|Config].
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   56:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
   57:     catch xref:stop(Server),
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: undefined_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   61:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
   62: 
   63:     %% Exclude calls from generated modules in the SSL application.
   64:     ExcludeFrom = "SSL-PKIX|PKIX.*|ssl_pkix_oid",
   65:     UndefS = xref_base:analysis(undefined_function_calls),
   66:     Q = io_lib:format("Undef = ~s,"
   67:                       "ExcludedFrom = ~p:_/_,"
   68:                       "Undef - Undef | ExcludedFrom",
   69:                       [UndefS,ExcludeFrom]),
   70:     {ok,Undef0} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q)),
   71: 
   72:     Filters = [fun erts_filter/1,
   73:                fun ssl_crypto_filter/1,
   74:                fun eunit_filter/1,
   75:                fun dialyzer_filter/1,
   76:                fun wx_filter/1,
   77:                fun diameter_filter/1],
   78:     Undef = lists:foldl(fun(Filter, Acc) ->
   79:                                 Filter(Acc)
   80:                         end, Undef0, Filters),
   81: 
   82:     case Undef of
   83:         [] -> ok;
   84:         _ ->
   85:             Fd = open_log(Config, "undefined_functions"),
   86:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
   87:                             ct:pal("~s calls undefined ~s",
   88:                                    [format_mfa(Server, MFA1),
   89:                                     format_mfa(MFA2)]),
   90:                             io:format(Fd, "~s ~s\n",
   91:                                       [format_mfa(Server, MFA1),
   92:                                        format_mfa(MFA2)])
   93:                     end, Undef),
   94:             close_log(Fd),
   95:             ct:fail({length(Undef),undefined_functions_in_otp})
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: ssl_crypto_filter(Undef) ->
   99:     case {app_exists(crypto),app_exists(ssl)} of
  100:         {false,false} ->
  101:             filter(fun({_,{ssl,_,_}}) -> false;
  102:                       ({_,{crypto,_,_}}) -> false;
  103:                       ({_,{ssh,_,_}}) -> false;
  104:                       ({_,{ssh_connection,_,_}}) -> false;
  105:                       ({_,{ssh_sftp,_,_}}) -> false;
  106:                       (_) -> true
  107:                    end, Undef);
  108:         {_,_} -> Undef
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: eunit_filter(Undef) ->
  112:     filter(fun({{eunit_test,wrapper_test_exported_,0},
  113:                 {eunit_test,nonexisting_function,0}}) -> false;
  114:               (_) -> true
  115:            end, Undef).
  116: 
  117: dialyzer_filter(Undef) ->
  118:     case app_exists(dialyzer) of
  119:         false ->
  120:             filter(fun({_,{dialyzer_callgraph,_,_}}) -> false;
  121:                       ({_,{dialyzer_codeserver,_,_}}) -> false;
  122:                       ({_,{dialyzer_contracts,_,_}}) -> false;
  123:                       ({_,{dialyzer_cl_parse,_,_}}) -> false;
  124:                       ({_,{dialyzer_timing,_,_}}) -> false;
  125:                       ({_,{dialyzer_plt,_,_}}) -> false;
  126:                       ({_,{dialyzer_succ_typings,_,_}}) -> false;
  127:                       ({_,{dialyzer_utils,_,_}}) -> false;
  128:                       (_) -> true
  129:                    end, Undef);
  130:         _ -> Undef
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: wx_filter(Undef) ->
  134:     case app_exists(wx) of
  135:         false ->
  136:             filter(fun({_,{MaybeWxModule,_,_}}) ->
  137:                            case atom_to_list(MaybeWxModule) of
  138:                                "wx"++_ -> false;
  139:                                _ -> true
  140:                            end
  141:                    end, Undef);
  142:         _ -> Undef
  143:     end.
  144: 
  145: diameter_filter(Undef) ->
  146:     %% Filter away function calls that are caught.
  147:     filter(fun({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,convert_time_unit,3}}) ->
  148:                    false;
  149:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,monotonic_time,0}}) ->
  150:                    false;
  151:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,unique_integer,0}}) ->
  152:                    false;
  153:               ({{diameter_lib,_,_},{erlang,time_offset,0}}) ->
  154:                    false;
  155:               (_) -> true
  156:            end, Undef).
  157: 
  158: erts_filter(Undef) ->
  159:     filter(fun({_,{prim_socket,_,_}}) -> lists:member(prim_socket, erlang:pre_loaded());
  160:               ({_,{prim_net,_,_}}) -> lists:member(prim_net, erlang:pre_loaded());
  161:               ({_,{socket_registry,_,_}}) -> lists:member(socket_registry, erlang:pre_loaded());
  162:               (_) -> true
  163:            end, Undef).
  164: 
  165: deprecated_not_in_obsolete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  167:     {ok,DeprecatedFunctions} = xref:q(Server, "DF"),
  168: 
  169:     L = foldl(fun({M,F,A}=MFA, Acc) ->
  170:                       case otp_internal:obsolete(M, F, A) of
  171:                           no -> [MFA|Acc];
  172:                           _ -> Acc
  173:                       end
  174:               end, [], DeprecatedFunctions),
  175:     case L of
  176:         [] -> ok;
  177:         _ ->
  178:             io:put_chars("The following functions have -deprecated() attributes,\n"
  179:                          "but are not listed in otp_internal:obsolete/3.\n"),
  180:             print_mfas(group_leader(), Server, L),
  181:             Fd = open_log(Config, "deprecated_not_obsolete"),
  182:             print_mfas(Fd, Server, L),
  183:             close_log(Fd),
  184:             ct:fail({length(L),deprecated_but_not_obsolete})
  185:     end.
  186: 
  187: obsolete_but_not_deprecated(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  189:     {ok,NotDeprecated} = xref:q(Server, "X - DF"),
  190: 
  191:     L = foldl(fun({M,F,A}=MFA, Acc) ->
  192:                       case otp_internal:obsolete(M, F, A) of
  193:                           no -> Acc;
  194:                           _ -> [MFA|Acc]
  195:                       end
  196:               end, [], NotDeprecated),
  197: 
  198:     case L of
  199:         [] -> ok;
  200:         _ ->
  201:             io:put_chars("The following functions are listed "
  202:                          "in otp_internal:obsolete/3,\n"
  203:                          "but don't have -deprecated() attributes.\n"),
  204:             print_mfas(group_leader(), Server, L),
  205:             Fd = open_log(Config, "obsolete_not_deprecated"),
  206:             print_mfas(Fd, Server, L),
  207:             close_log(Fd),
  208:             ct:fail({length(L),obsolete_but_not_deprecated})
  209:     end.
  210: 
  211: call_to_deprecated(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  212:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  213:     {ok,DeprecatedCalls} = xref:q(Server, "strict(E || DF)"),
  214:     foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  215:                     io:format("~s calls deprecated ~s",
  216:                               [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  217:             end, DeprecatedCalls),
  218:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(DeprecatedCalls))++" calls to deprecated functions"}.
  219: 
  220: call_to_size_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     %% Applications that do not call erlang:size/1:
  222:     Apps = [asn1,compiler,debugger,kernel,observer,parsetools,
  223:             runtime_tools,stdlib,tools],
  224:     not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps, {erlang,size,1}).
  225: 
  226: call_to_now_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     %% Applications that do not call erlang:now/1:
  228:     Apps = [asn1,common_test,compiler,debugger,dialyzer,
  229:             kernel,mnesia,observer,parsetools,reltool,
  230:             runtime_tools,sasl,stdlib,syntax_tools,
  231:             tools],
  232:     not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps, {erlang,now,0}).
  233: 
  234: not_recommended_calls(Config, Apps0, MFA) ->
  235:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  236: 
  237:     Apps = [App || App <- Apps0, is_present_application(App, Server)],
  238: 
  239:     Fs = [MFA],
  240: 
  241:     Q1 = io_lib:format("E || ~p : Fun", [Fs]),
  242:     {ok,AllCallsToMFA} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q1)),
  243: 
  244:     Q2 = io_lib:format("E | ~p : App || ~p : Fun", [Apps,Fs]),
  245:     {ok,CallsToMFA} = xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q2)),
  246: 
  247:     case CallsToMFA of
  248:         [] ->
  249:             ok;
  250:         _ ->
  251:             io:format("These calls are not allowed:\n"),
  252:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  253:                             io:format("~s calls non-recommended ~s",
  254:                                       [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  255:                     end, CallsToMFA)
  256:     end,
  257: 
  258:     %% Enumerate calls to MFA from other applications than
  259:     %% the ones known not to call MFA:
  260:     case AllCallsToMFA--CallsToMFA of
  261:         [] ->
  262:             ok;
  263:         Calls ->
  264:             io:format("~n~nThese calls are allowed for now:\n"),
  265:             foreach(fun ({MFA1,MFA2}) ->
  266:                             io:format("~s calls non-recommended ~s",
  267:                                       [format_mfa(MFA1),format_mfa(MFA2)])
  268:                     end, Calls)
  269:     end,
  270:     case CallsToMFA of
  271:         [] ->
  272:             SkippedApps = ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(Apps0),
  273:                                            ordsets:from_list(Apps)),
  274:             case SkippedApps of
  275:                 [] ->
  276:                     ok;
  277:                 _ ->
  278:                     AppStrings = [atom_to_list(A) || A <- SkippedApps],
  279:                     Mess = io_lib:format("Application(s) not present: ~s\n",
  280:                                          [lists:join(", ", AppStrings)]),
  281:                     {comment, Mess}
  282:             end;
  283:         _ ->
  284:             ct:fail({length(CallsToMFA),calls_to_size_1})
  285:     end.
  286: 
  287: is_present_application(Name, Server) ->
  288:     Q = io_lib:format("~w : App", [Name]),
  289:     case xref:q(Server, lists:flatten(Q)) of
  290:         {ok,[Name]} -> true;
  291:         {error,_,_} -> false
  292:     end.
  293: 
  294: strong_components(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  296:     {ok,Cs} = xref:q(Server, "components AE"),
  297:     io:format("\n\nStrong components:\n\n~p\n", [Cs]),
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: erl_file_encoding(_Config) ->
  301:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  302:     Wc = filename:join([Root,"**","*.erl"]),
  303:     ErlFiles = ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(Wc)),
  304:                                 release_files(Root, "*.erl")),
  305:     {ok, MP} = re:compile(".*lib/(ic)|(orber)|(cos).*", [unicode]),
  306:     Fs = [F || F <- ErlFiles,
  307:                filter_use_latin1_coding(F, MP),
  308:                case epp:read_encoding(F) of
  309:                    none -> false;
  310:                    _ -> true
  311:                end],
  312:     case Fs of
  313:         [] ->
  314:             ok;
  315:         [_|_] ->
  316:             io:put_chars("Files with \"coding:\":\n"),
  317:             [io:put_chars(F) || F <- Fs],
  318:             ct:fail(failed)
  319:     end.
  320: 
  321: filter_use_latin1_coding(F, MP) ->
  322:     case re:run(F, MP) of
  323:         nomatch ->
  324:             true;
  325:         {match, _} ->
  326:             false
  327:     end.
  328: 
  329: xml_file_encoding(_Config) ->
  330:     XmlFiles = xml_files(),
  331:     Fs = [F || F <- XmlFiles, is_bad_encoding(F)],
  332:     case Fs of
  333:         [] ->
  334:             ok;
  335:         [_|_] ->
  336:             io:put_chars("Encoding should be \"utf-8\" or \"UTF-8\":\n"),
  337:             [io:put_chars(F) || F <- Fs],
  338:             ct:fail(failed)
  339:     end.
  340: 
  341: xml_files() ->
  342:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  343:     AllWc = filename:join([Root,"**","*.xml"]),
  344:     AllXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(AllWc)),
  345:     TestsWc = filename:join([Root,"lib","*","test","**","*.xml"]),
  346:     TestXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(TestsWc)),
  347:     XmerlWc = filename:join([Root,"lib","xmerl","**","*.xml"]),
  348:     XmerlXmlFiles = ordsets:from_list(filelib:wildcard(XmerlWc)),
  349:     Ignore = ordsets:union([TestXmlFiles,XmerlXmlFiles,
  350:                             release_files(Root, "*.xml")]),
  351:     ordsets:subtract(AllXmlFiles, Ignore).
  352: 
  353: release_files(Root, Ext) ->
  354:     Wc = filename:join([Root,"release","**",Ext]),
  355:     filelib:wildcard(Wc).
  356: 
  357: is_bad_encoding(File) ->
  358:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  359:     case Bin of
  360:         <<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-8\"",_/binary>> ->
  361:             false;
  362:         <<"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"",_/binary>> ->
  363:             false;
  364:         _ ->
  365:             true
  366:     end.
  367: 
  368: %% Test runtime dependencies when using an Xref server running in
  369: %% 'functions' mode.
  370: 
  371: runtime_dependencies_functions(Config) ->
  372:     Server = proplists:get_value(xref_server, Config),
  373:     runtime_dependencies(Server).
  374: 
  375: %% Test runtime dependencies when using an xref server running in
  376: %% 'modules' mode. Note that more module edges can potentially be
  377: %% found in this mode because the analysis is based on the BEAM
  378: %% code after all optimizations. For example, an apply in the source
  379: %% code could after optimizations be resolved to a specific function.
  380: %%
  381: %% It is important to test 'modules' because reltool runs xref in
  382: %% 'modules' mode (the BEAM files to be released might not contain
  383: %% debug information).
  384: 
  385: runtime_dependencies_modules(_Config) ->
  386:     Server = start_xref_server(?FUNCTION_NAME, modules),
  387:     try
  388:         runtime_dependencies(Server)
  389:     after
  390:         catch xref:stop(Server)
  391:     end.
  392: 
  393: runtime_dependencies(Server) ->
  394:     %% Ignore applications intentionally not declaring dependencies
  395:     %% found by xref.
  396:     IgnoreApps = [diameter],
  397: 
  398:     %% Verify that (at least) OTP application runtime dependencies found
  399:     %% by xref are listed in the runtime_dependencies field of the .app file
  400:     %% of each application.
  401:     {ok, AE} = xref:q(Server, "AE"),
  402:     SAE = lists:keysort(1, AE),
  403:     put(ignored_failures, []),
  404:     {AppDep, AppDeps} = lists:foldl(fun ({App, App}, Acc) ->
  405:                                             Acc;
  406:                                         ({App, Dep}, {undefined, []}) ->
  407:                                             {{App, [Dep]}, []};
  408:                                         ({App, Dep}, {{App, Deps}, AppDeps}) ->
  409:                                             {{App, [Dep|Deps]}, AppDeps};
  410:                                         ({App, Dep}, {AppDep, AppDeps}) ->
  411:                                             {{App, [Dep]}, [AppDep | AppDeps]}
  412:                                     end,
  413:                                     {undefined, []},
  414:                                     SAE),
  415:     [] = check_apps_deps([AppDep|AppDeps], IgnoreApps),
  416:     case IgnoreApps of
  417:         [] ->
  418:             ok;
  419:         _ ->
  420:             Comment = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Ignored applications: ~p "
  421:                                                   "Ignored failures: ~p",
  422:                                                   [IgnoreApps,
  423:                                                    get(ignored_failures)])),
  424:             {comment, Comment}
  425:     end.
  426: 
  427: have_rdep(_App, [], _Dep) ->
  428:     false;
  429: have_rdep(App, [RDep | RDeps], Dep) ->		    
  430:     [AppStr, _VsnStr] = string:lexemes(RDep, "-"),
  431:     case Dep == list_to_atom(AppStr) of
  432:         true ->
  433:             %% io:format("~p -> ~s~n", [App, RDep]),
  434:             true;
  435:         false ->
  436:             have_rdep(App, RDeps, Dep)
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: check_app_deps(_App, _AppFile, _AFDeps, [], _IgnoreApps) ->
  440:     [];
  441: check_app_deps(App, AppFile, AFDeps, [XRDep | XRDeps], IgnoreApps) ->
  442:     ResOtherDeps = check_app_deps(App, AppFile, AFDeps, XRDeps, IgnoreApps),
  443:     case have_rdep(App, AFDeps, XRDep) of
  444:         true ->
  445:             ResOtherDeps;
  446:         false ->
  447:             Failure = {missing_runtime_dependency, AppFile, XRDep},
  448:             case lists:member(App, IgnoreApps) of
  449:                 true ->
  450:                     put(ignored_failures, [Failure | get(ignored_failures)]),
  451:                     ResOtherDeps;
  452:                 false ->
  453:                     [Failure | ResOtherDeps]
  454:             end
  455:     end.
  456: 
  457: check_apps_deps([], _IgnoreApps) ->
  458:     [];
  459: check_apps_deps([{App, Deps}|AppDeps], IgnoreApps) ->
  460:     ResOtherApps = check_apps_deps(AppDeps, IgnoreApps),
  461:     AppFile = code:where_is_file(atom_to_list(App) ++ ".app"),
  462:     {ok,[{application, App, Info}]} = file:consult(AppFile),
  463:     case lists:keyfind(runtime_dependencies, 1, Info) of
  464:         {runtime_dependencies, RDeps} ->
  465:             check_app_deps(App, AppFile, RDeps, Deps, IgnoreApps)
  466:             ++ ResOtherApps;
  467:         false ->
  468:             Failure = {missing_runtime_dependencies_key, AppFile},
  469:             case lists:member(App, IgnoreApps) of
  470:                 true ->
  471:                     put(ignored_failures, [Failure | get(ignored_failures)]),
  472:                     ResOtherApps;
  473:                 false ->
  474:                     [Failure | ResOtherApps]
  475:             end
  476:     end.
  477: 
  478: %%%
  479: %%% Common help functions.
  480: %%%
  481: 
  482: print_mfas(Fd, Server, MFAs) ->
  483:     [io:format(Fd, "~s\n", [format_mfa(Server, MFA)]) || MFA <- MFAs],
  484:     ok.
  485: 
  486: format_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
  487:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~s:~s/~p", [M,F,A])).
  488: 
  489: format_mfa(Server, MFA) ->
  490:     MFAString = format_mfa(MFA),
  491:     AQ = "(App)" ++ MFAString,
  492:     AppPrefix = case xref:q(Server, AQ) of
  493:                     {ok,[App]} -> "[" ++ atom_to_list(App) ++ "]";
  494:                     _ -> ""
  495:                 end,
  496:     AppPrefix ++ MFAString.
  497: 
  498: open_log(Config, Name) ->
  499:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  500:     RunDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(PrivDir)),
  501:     Path = filename:join(RunDir, "system_"++Name++".log"),
  502:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Path, [write]),
  503:     Fd.
  504: 
  505: close_log(Fd) ->
  506:     ok = file:close(Fd).
  507: 
  508: app_exists(AppAtom) ->
  509:     case code:lib_dir(AppAtom) of
  510:         {error,bad_name} ->
  511:             false;
  512:         Path ->
  513:             case file:read_file_info(filename:join(Path,"ebin")) of
  514:                 {ok,_} ->
  515:                     true;
  516:                 _ ->
  517:                     false
  518:             end
  519:     end.
  520: 
  521: start_xref_server(Server, Mode) ->
  522:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  523:     xref:start(Server, [{xref_mode,Mode}]),
  524:     xref:set_default(Server, [{verbose,false},
  525:                               {warnings,false},
  526:                               {builtins,true}]),
  527:     {ok,_Relname} = xref:add_release(Server, Root, {name,otp}),
  528: 
  529:     case code:lib_dir(erts) of
  530:         {error,bad_name} ->
  531:             %% This should not be possible since code_server always adds
  532:             %% an entry for erts.
  533:             ct:fail(no_erts_lib_dir);
  534:         LibDir ->
  535:             case filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "ebin")) of
  536:                 false ->
  537:                     %% If we are running the tests in the git repository,
  538:                     %% the preloaded BEAM files for Erts are not in the
  539:                     %% code path. We must add them explicitly.
  540:                     Erts = filename:join([LibDir,"preloaded","ebin"]),
  541:                     {ok,_} = xref:add_directory(Server, Erts, []);
  542:                 true ->
  543:                     ok
  544:             end
  545:     end,
  546:     Server.
  547: 
  548: get_suite_data_dir_path() ->
  549:     filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "otp_SUITE_data").
  550: 
  551: get_otp_versions_table_path() ->
  552:     filename:join(get_suite_data_dir_path(), "otp_versions.table").
  553: 
  554: get_otp_version_tickets_path() ->
  555:     filename:join(get_suite_data_dir_path(), "otp_version_tickets").
  556: 
  557: %% Return a map that maps from app versions to the OTP versions they
  558: %% were last released in. The function makes use of the file
  559: %% "otp_versions.table" and the current code:get_path() to
  560: %% find apps.
  561: get_runtime_dep_to_otp_version_map() ->
  562:     %% Find apps in "otp_versions.table"
  563:     VersionsTableFile = get_otp_versions_table_path(),
  564:     VersionsTableBin =
  565:         case file:read_file(VersionsTableFile) of
  566:             {ok, Bin} -> Bin;
  567:             Error -> ct:fail("Could not read the file ~s which is needed to perform the test. "
  568:                              "Error: ~p~n",
  569:                              [VersionsTableFile, Error])
  570:         end,
  571:     VersionsTableStr = erlang:binary_to_list(VersionsTableBin),
  572:     Lines = lists:reverse(string:tokens(VersionsTableStr, "\n")),
  573:     AddVersionsInString =
  574:         fun(Map, OTPVersion, AppVersionsString0) ->
  575:                 AppVersionsString =
  576:                     lists:flatten(string:replace(AppVersionsString0, "#", "", all)),
  577:                 AppVersions = string:tokens(AppVersionsString, " "),
  578:                 lists:foldl(
  579:                   fun(AppVersion0, MapSoFar) ->
  580:                           case string:trim(AppVersion0) of
  581:                               "" ->
  582:                                   MapSoFar;
  583:                               AppVersion1 ->
  584:                                   maps:put(AppVersion1, OTPVersion, MapSoFar)
  585:                           end
  586:                   end,
  587:                   Map,
  588:                   AppVersions)
  589:         end,
  590:     VersionMap0 =
  591:         lists:foldl(
  592:           fun(Line, MapSoFar) ->
  593:                   [OTPVersion, AppVersionsString| _] =
  594:                       string:tokens(Line, ":"),
  595:                   AddVersionsInString(MapSoFar,
  596:                                       string:trim(OTPVersion),
  597:                                       string:trim(AppVersionsString))
  598:           end,
  599:           #{},
  600:           Lines),
  601:     %% Find apps in code:get_path()
  602:     lists:foldl(
  603:       fun(Path, MapSoFar) ->
  604:               case filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Path, "*.app")) of
  605:                   [AppFile] ->
  606:                       {ok,[{application, App, Info}]} = file:consult(AppFile),
  607:                       case lists:keyfind(vsn, 1, Info) of
  608:                           false ->
  609:                               MapSoFar;
  610:                           {vsn, VsnStr} ->
  611:                               AppVsnStr =
  612:                                   erlang:atom_to_list(App) ++ "-" ++ VsnStr,
  613:                               maps:put(AppVsnStr, {latest, Path}, MapSoFar)
  614:                       end;
  615:                   _ ->
  616:                       MapSoFar
  617:               end
  618:       end,
  619:       VersionMap0,
  620:       code:get_path()).
  621: 
  622: %% Find runtime dependencies for an app
  623: get_runtime_deps(App) ->
  624:     AppFile = code:where_is_file(atom_to_list(App) ++ ".app"),
  625:     {ok,[{application, App, Info}]} = file:consult(AppFile),
  626:     case lists:keyfind(runtime_dependencies, 1, Info) of
  627:         {runtime_dependencies, RDeps} ->
  628:             RDeps;
  629:         false ->
  630:             []
  631:     end.
  632: 
  633: %% Given a release dir find the path to the given dependency
  634: find_dep_in_rel_dir(Dep, RelDirRoot) ->
  635:     %% The dependencies that we have found are cached to avoid
  636:     %% searching through the file system unnecessary many times
  637:     CacheId = runtime_dep_test_cache,
  638:     DepCache =
  639:         case erlang:get(CacheId) of
  640:             undefined -> #{};
  641:             M-> M
  642:         end,
  643:     case maps:get(Dep, DepCache, none) of
  644:         none ->
  645:             DepPaths = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([RelDirRoot, "lib", "**", Dep, "ebin"])),
  646:             case DepPaths of
  647:                 [Path] ->
  648:                     erlang:put(CacheId, maps:put(Dep, Path, DepCache)),
  649:                     Path;
  650:                 _ ->
  651:                     ErrorMessage =
  652:                         io_lib:format("ERROR: Could not find ~p in ~p (where it is supposed to be)."
  653:                                       "Found ~p~n", [Dep, RelDirRoot, DepPaths]),
  654:                     io:format(lists:flatten(ErrorMessage)),
  655:                     ct:fail(ErrorMessage)
  656: 
  657:             end;
  658:         Path ->
  659:             Path
  660:     end.
  661: 
  662: %% Get the major OTP version part of an OTP version string
  663: %% Example: OTP-22.0 gives 22
  664: get_major_version(OtpVersion) ->
  665:     [_,MajorVersion|_] = string:tokens(OtpVersion, "-."),
  666:     MajorVersion.
  667: 
  668: %% Returns the release directory for the oldest available OTP release
  669: %% on the current machine
  670: first_available_otp_rel() ->
  671:     %% At least one version less than the current version should be available
  672:     SholdBeAvailable = erlang:list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)) - 1,
  673:     (fun FindOldest(CurrRel, PrevAvailable) ->
  674:              case test_server:is_release_available(erlang:integer_to_list(CurrRel)) of
  675:                  false -> PrevAvailable;
  676:                  true -> FindOldest(CurrRel-1, erlang:integer_to_list(CurrRel))
  677:              end
  678:      end)(SholdBeAvailable, none).
  679: 
  680: %% Searches for the oldest available version of Dep
  681: get_oldest_available_version_of_dep(Dep) ->
  682:     [DepName, _Version] = string:tokens(Dep, "-"),
  683:     FirstAvailableRel = first_available_otp_rel(),
  684:     (fun Find(LookInRel) ->
  685:              case test_server:is_release_available(LookInRel) of
  686:                  true ->
  687:                      RelRoot = find_rel_root(LookInRel),
  688:                      Options0 = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([RelRoot, "lib", "**", "ebin"])),
  689:                      Options1 = [Opt ||
  690:                                    Opt <- Options0,
  691:                                    string:find(Opt,
  692:                                                filename:join("lib", DepName ++ "-")) =/= nomatch],
  693:                      GetVersionTuple =
  694:                          fun(Path) ->
  695:                                  [AppVerStr] =
  696:                                      [C || C <- filename:split(Path),
  697:                                            string:find(C, DepName ++ "-") =/= nomatch],
  698:                                  [_,VerStr] = string:tokens(AppVerStr, "-"),
  699:                                  erlang:list_to_tuple([erlang:list_to_integer(X) ||
  700:                                                           X <- string:tokens(VerStr, ".")])
  701:                          end,
  702:                      Options2 =
  703:                          lists:sort(fun(A,B) ->
  704:                                             GetVersionTuple(A) =< GetVersionTuple(B)
  705:                                     end,
  706:                                     Options1),
  707:                      case Options2 of
  708:                          [Path|_] ->
  709:                              Path;
  710:                          _ ->
  711:                              NextRelToTry =
  712:                                  erlang:integer_to_list(erlang:list_to_integer(LookInRel)+1),
  713:                              Find(NextRelToTry)
  714:                      end;
  715:                  false ->
  716:                      ct:fail({could_not_find_dep_anywhere, DepName})
  717:              end
  718:      end)(FirstAvailableRel).
  719: 
  720: find_rel_root(Rel) ->
  721:     case test_server:find_release(Rel) of
  722:         not_available ->
  723:             not_available;
  724:         OtpRelErl -> filename:dirname(filename:dirname(OtpRelErl))
  725:     end.
  726: 
  727: %% Find the absolute paths to RuntimeDeps
  728: get_paths_to_dependencies(App, RuntimeDeps) ->
  729:     FirstAvailableOTPRel = first_available_otp_rel(),
  730:     FirstAvailableRel = erlang:list_to_integer(FirstAvailableOTPRel),
  731:     DepToOtpVerMap = get_runtime_dep_to_otp_version_map(),
  732:     lists:foldl(
  733:       fun(Dep, SoFar) ->
  734:               case maps:get(Dep, DepToOtpVerMap, false) of
  735:                   false ->
  736:                       ct:fail(io_lib:format(
  737:                                 "The dependency ~s for ~p could not be found. "
  738:                                 "Have you typed a non-existing version?",
  739:                                 [Dep, App]));
  740:                   {latest, Path} ->
  741:                       %% The dependency is in Path (one of the paths returned by code:get_paths())
  742:                       [Path | SoFar];
  743:                   OtpVersionWithDep ->
  744:                       OtpMajorVersionWithDep = get_major_version(OtpVersionWithDep),
  745:                       OtpMajorVersionWithDepInt = erlang:list_to_integer(OtpMajorVersionWithDep),
  746:                       case find_rel_root(OtpMajorVersionWithDep) of
  747:                           not_available when FirstAvailableRel > OtpMajorVersionWithDepInt ->
  748:                               io:format("Warning: Could not find runtime dependency ~p for ~p. "
  749:                                         "~p belongs to ~p but ~p is too old to be available on this machine. "
  750:                                         "Trying to find the oldest available version of ~p...",
  751:                                         [Dep, App, Dep, OtpVersionWithDep, OtpVersionWithDep, Dep]),
  752:                               [get_oldest_available_version_of_dep(Dep) | SoFar];
  753:                           RelDirRoot ->
  754:                               [find_dep_in_rel_dir(Dep, RelDirRoot) | SoFar]
  755:                       end
  756:               end
  757:       end,
  758:       [],
  759:       RuntimeDeps).
  760: 
  761: test_app_runtime_deps_versions(AppPath, App, IgnoredUndefinedFunctions) ->
  762:     %% Get a list of all runtime dependencies for app
  763:     RuntimeDeps = get_runtime_deps(App),
  764:     %% Get paths to the found runtime dependencies
  765:     DepPaths = get_paths_to_dependencies(App, RuntimeDeps),
  766:     XRefSName = test_app_runtime_deps_versions_server,
  767:     %% Start xref server and do the test
  768:     {ok, _} = xref:start(XRefSName, []),
  769:     ok = xref:set_library_path(XRefSName, DepPaths),
  770:     Dir = filename:join(AppPath, "ebin"),
  771:     {ok, _} = xref:add_directory(XRefSName, Dir),
  772:     {ok, UndefinedFunctions0} = xref:analyze(XRefSName, undefined_functions),
  773:     xref:stop(XRefSName),
  774:     %% Filter out undefined functions that we should ignore
  775:     UndefinedFunctions1 =
  776:         [F || F <- UndefinedFunctions0,
  777:               not maps:get(F, IgnoredUndefinedFunctions, false),
  778:               not maps:get({element(1,F),'_','_'}, IgnoredUndefinedFunctions, false),
  779:               not maps:get({element(1,F),element(2,F),'_'}, IgnoredUndefinedFunctions, false)],
  780:     case UndefinedFunctions1 of
  781:         [] ->
  782:             ok;
  783:         UndefinedFunctions ->
  784:             {error_undefined_functions_in_app, App, UndefinedFunctions}
  785:     end.
  786: 
  787: test_runtime_dependencies_versions_rels(IgnoreApps, AppsToIgnoredUndefinedFunctions) ->
  788:     %% Do for every application:
  789:     %%    1. Find deps from app file
  790:     %%    2. Find where the deps are installed
  791:     %%    3. Run xref tests on the apps with the specified dependencies
  792:     %%    4. Report error if undefined function
  793:     Apps0 = [{Path, list_to_atom(AppName)}
  794:              || {match, [Path, AppName]}
  795:                     <- [re:run(X,"(" ++ code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*)/ebin",
  796:                                [{capture,[1,2],list},unicode]) || X <- code:get_path()]],
  797:     Apps = [{Path, App} ||
  798:                {Path, App} <- Apps0,
  799:                code:where_is_file(atom_to_list(App) ++ ".app") =/= non_existing],
  800:     Res = [test_app_runtime_deps_versions(AppPath,
  801:                                           App,
  802:                                           maps:get(App, AppsToIgnoredUndefinedFunctions, #{})) ||
  803:               {AppPath, App} <- Apps, not lists:member(App, IgnoreApps)],
  804:     BadRes = [R || R <- Res, R =/= ok],
  805:     case BadRes =:= [] of
  806:         true -> ok;
  807:         _ ->
  808:             ct:fail(BadRes)
  809:     end.
  810: 
  811: is_development_build() ->
  812:     {ok, FileContentBin} = file:read_file(get_otp_version_tickets_path()),
  813:     "DEVELOPMENT" =:= string:trim(erlang:binary_to_list(FileContentBin), both, "\n ").
  814: 
  815: test_runtime_dependencies_versions(_Config) ->
  816:     ReleasesDir = "/usr/local/otp/releases",
  817:     IgnoreApps = [],
  818:     SocketIgnore = case lists:member(prim_socket, erlang:pre_loaded()) of
  819:                         true -> #{};
  820:                         false ->
  821:                             Ignore = #{{prim_socket,'_','_'} => true,
  822:                                        {socket_registry,'_','_'} => true,
  823:                                        {prim_net,'_','_'} => true },
  824:                             #{ kernel => Ignore, erts => Ignore }
  825:                     end,
  826:     AppsToIgnoredUndefinedFunctions =
  827:         #{eunit =>
  828:               %% Intentional call to nonexisting function
  829:               #{{eunit_test, nonexisting_function, 0} => true},
  830:          diameter =>
  831:               %% The following functions are optional dependencies for diameter
  832:               #{{dbg,ctp,0} => true,
  833:                 {dbg,p,2} => true,
  834:                 {dbg,stop_clear,0} => true,
  835:                 {dbg,trace_port,2} => true,
  836:                 {dbg,tracer,2} => true,
  837:                 {erl_prettypr,format,1} => true,
  838:                 {erl_syntax,form_list,1} => true},
  839:          common_test =>
  840:               %% ftp:start/0 has been part of the ftp application from
  841:               %% the beginning so it is unclear why xref report this
  842:               %% as undefined
  843:               #{{ftp,start,0} => true}},
  844:     case {erlang:element(1, os:type()) =:= unix,
  845:           not is_development_build(),
  846:           filelib:is_dir(ReleasesDir),
  847:           filelib:is_file(get_otp_versions_table_path()),
  848:           first_available_otp_rel() =/= none} of
  849:         {true, true, true, true, true} ->
  850:             test_runtime_dependencies_versions_rels(
  851:                 IgnoreApps,
  852:                 maps:merge(AppsToIgnoredUndefinedFunctions, SocketIgnore));
  853:         {_, _ ,_, false, _} -> {skip,
  854:                              "Could not find the file \"otp_versions.table\". "
  855:                              "Check that the test has been built correctly. "
  856:                              "\"otp_versions.table\" is copied to \"erts/test/otp_SUITE_data\" "
  857:                              "by the makefile \"erts/test/Makefile\""};
  858:         {_, false , _, _, _} -> {skip,
  859:                               "This test case is designed to run in the Erlang/OTP teams "
  860:                               "test system for nightly tests. The test case depend on that "
  861:                               "app versions have been set correctly by scripts that "
  862:                               "are executed before creating builds for the nightly tests."};
  863:         {_, _ ,false, _, _} -> {skip, "Can not do the tests without a proper releases dir. "
  864:                              "Check that " ++ ReleasesDir ++ " is set up correctly."};
  865:         {_, _ , _, _, false} ->
  866:             PrevRelNr = erlang:list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)) - 1,
  867:             PrevRelNrStr = erlang:integer_to_list(PrevRelNr),
  868:             {skip,
  869:              "Seems like the releases dir is not set up correctly. "
  870:              "Is release " ++ PrevRelNrStr ++ " installed in the releases dir? "
  871:              "(releases dir = " ++ ReleasesDir ++ ")"};
  872:         {false, _ ,_, _, _} -> {skip, "This test only runs on Unix systems"}
  873:     end.
